title: unesco_heritage_Studley_Royal_Park_including_the_Ruins_of_Fountains_Abbey
text:
Name: Studley Royal Park including the Ruins of Fountains Abbey. short_description:

In the 18th century a designed landscape of exceptional beauty was created around the ruins of the Cistercian Fountains Abbey, in Yorkshire. The spectacular ruins of the 12th century abbey and water mill, the Jacobean mansion of Fountains Hall, the Victorian masterpiece St Maryâ€™s Church and one of the most magnificent Georgian water gardens ever created, make this a landscape of outstanding merit.
